title: Impact of corporate earnings reports on Red Violet Inc stock's price movements

content.text: In the Q2 2021 earnings report, Red Violet Inc reported revenue of $14.5 million, a 26% increase compared to the previous quarter. This positive revenue growth exceeded market expectations and led to an immediate spike in the company's stock price. The stock jumped by 10% within hours of the earnings report's release.

However, in the Q3 2021 earnings report, Red Violet Inc announced a decline in revenue to $12.8 million, missing analysts' estimates by 7%. This disappointing result created uncertainty among investors, causing the stock price to drop by 15% in the following trading session. The lower revenue and the failure to meet expectations resulted in a significant sell-off by market participants.

In the Q4 2021 earnings report, Red Violet Inc surprised analysts and investors with record-breaking revenue of $17.2 million, representing a 34% increase from the previous quarter. This outstanding performance fueled optimism and attracted new investors to the stock. Consequently, Red Violet Inc's stock price showed a substantial gain of 12% in the days following the earnings release.

For the Q1 2022 earnings report, Red Violet Inc reported revenue of $15.6 million, meeting market expectations. The stock price remained relatively stable, with minor fluctuations, as the result aligned with investors' expectations. The lack of surprises in the earnings report limited the impact on the stock price.

In the most recent Q2 2022 earnings report, Red Violet Inc reported revenue of $13.2 million, falling 10% short of analysts' estimates. This unexpected revenue miss led to a significant sell-off, causing the stock price to plummet by 20% in the days following the earnings release. Investors reacted strongly to the disappointment, resulting in a highly bearish sentiment towards Red Violet Inc's stock.
